DataElement.preferredName: Adverse Event Protocol Therapy Attribution Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the relation of causality between protocol treatment and the specific adverse event.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Investigational Clinical Study Therapy Attribution
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of an investigational therapy, the action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process being studied as defined by the clinical study, research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: In the process of being studied; experimental.  (NCI):Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research. :An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:assigning to a cause or source.

Concepts.definition: In the process of being studied; experimental.

Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.
To assign to a cause or source.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: scale of values to indicate the causal relation between the treatment modality and the specific adverse event.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of very strong agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of very strong agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A measure of the expectation of the occurrence of a particular event.

Concepts.definition: A measure of the expectation of the occurrence of a particular event.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having little chance of being the case or of coming about.

Concepts.definition: Having little chance of being the case or of coming about.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not connected or associated e.g. by kinship.

Concepts.definition: Not connected or associated e.g. by kinship.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
